title: In Search of Enheduanna, the Woman Who Was History’s First Named Author
description: “She Who Wrote,” an exhibition at the Morgan Library, explores the world of an ancient Mesopotamian priestess who wrote with a strikingly personal voice.
dc:creator: Jennifer Schuessler
media:credit: Lila Barth for The New York Times
media:description: Two Mesopotamian sculptures from around 2112-2004 B.C., included in “She Who Wrote,” an exhibition at the Morgan Library & Museum. The figure in the background holds a tablet in her lap, as if ready to write.
